result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Haro-Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Court orders 4 1/2 months jail be imposed and stayed.

miscConds.notes:
$2,500.00 cash bond to be applied.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with EMHS.
Must have no unsupervised contact with any minor females.

Must undergo a psychosexual evaluation and comply with any recommended follow-up treatment.  The evaluation must be completed within the first 90 days of Probation.
Issue of sex offender registration is held open pending results of the evaluation.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

03/27/15 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT TO SUBMIT A DNA SAMPLE.

timeConds.notes:
Sentence to begin today, February 25, 2015 by 3:00 PM.
Work release/Huber granted.

Defendant Ricardo  Haro-Sanchez in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:18: Interpreter, Nick Rodriguez, sworn and provides interpretation for Defendant.  
Amended Information filed. Defense relates agreement. 
Defendant pleads guilty to the amended charge. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
Argument by State. Argument by Defense.

Court relates and orders: 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence
4.5 months jail - STAYED. 

1 year probation - IMPOSED
Must undergo a psychosexual evaluation and comply with any recommended follow-up treatment.  The evaluation must be completed within the first 90 days of probation. 
Sex Offender Registration is to be held open pending results of the evaluation. 
Must have no contact with EMHS. 
Must have no unsupervised contact with any minor females. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court costs.
15 days jail with work release/huber. 3 days jail credit. Must report to jail by 3:00 PM.
